== Desktop Live Session ==

==== Live Session Start ====
<<BR>>
'''Case ID: ''' dls-001

# Start your machine with the install media in place
# When ubiquity start select your language in the left column
# Press '''Try Ubuntu-"version"'''
# Wait for the Live session to start
<<BR>>
If you press any key at startup or if you are testing another distribution (Kubuntu, Xubuntu, etc.) the testcase will be as described below
# Start your machine with the install media in place
# Select your language for the install and press '''Enter'''
# Select '''Try without any change to your computer''' and press '''Enter'''
# Wait for the Live session to start

<<BR>>
<nowiki>[[https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/casper/+filebug|File a bug]]</nowiki>

==== Live Session Finish ====
'''Case ID: ''' dls-002

# Click on '''ubuntu''' top right
# Select '''Shut down...''' from the drop down list
# Ensure you get a dialog confirming the shutdown, select '''Shut Down''' from it
# Remove install media and press '''Enter'''

<nowiki>[[https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/casper/+filebug|File a bug]]</nowiki>

==== Live Session Persistence ====
'''Case ID: ''' dls-003

# Create a partition (on a usb stick or regular disk/image) with a label of 'casper-rw'
# Boot machine with install media
# Start your machine with the install media in place
# When ubiquity start select your language in the left column
# Press '''Try Ubuntu-"version"'''
# Browse webpages in firefox. 
# Restart live image back into a persistent session
# Browse with firefox again; awesomebar should suggest webpages that you visited in the previous session
<<BR>>
If you press any key at startup or if you are testing another distribution (Kubuntu, Xubuntu, etc.) the testcase will be as described below

# Create a partition (on a usb stick or regular disk/image) with a label of 'casper-rw'
# Boot machine with install media
# Select your language for the install and press '''Enter'''
# Select '''Try without any change to your computer'''
# Press '''<F6>''' and add '''persistent''' to the boot command line and press '''enter'''
# Wait for the Live session to start
# Browse webpages in firefox. 
# Restart live image back into a persistent session
# Browse with firefox again; awesomebar should suggest webpages that you visited in the previous session

(test based off of documentation at <nowiki>[[https://help.ubuntu.com/community/LiveCD/Persistence | LiveCD/Persistence]]</nowiki>)
